headline.main: One Corner of Afghanistan Peacefully Selects a Governor

lead_paragraph: Peace reigned here today. The governor's palace guard, in legal uniforms mothballed since the days of the king decades ago, marched past rose gardens, cypresses, swaybacked palms and feathery pines. They wore sneakers. They looked proud.
abstract: Hajji Abdul Qadir is peacefully installed as governor of Jalalabad, Afghanistan, three days after Taliban withdrew without fight; he is rare member of educated Afghan elites still living in country; appeals to world to help Afghanistan form broad-based government; photos (M)
snippet: Peace reigned here today.    The governor's palace guard, in legal uniforms mothballed since the days of the king decades ago, marched past rose gardens, cypresses, swaybacked palms and feathery pines. They wore sneakers. They looked proud....
